results.title: Acla
results.creator_credit: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, Pentafilm, Nova Films and CineEuropa '92
results.brief_description: In the 1930s and 11-year-old Sicilian boy, Acla, is sold to a sulphur miner, and for five years from Monday to Saturday, the boy is made the miner’s property, spending the whole week down the mine, going home on Saturday and Sunday. There he experiences the inhuman world of the sulphur mines, the stifling, choking tunnels and the physical and sexual violence that everybody indulges in by unspoked agreement. He attempts several escapes, but each time he is caught and beaten. Until the last attempt, when finally he reaches the sea. And freedom… In Italian language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, Pentafilm, Nova Films and CineEuropa ‘92

results.title: Acid rain
results.brief_description: Notes the startling scale of acidified lakes in Europe and looks at the impact of acid rain on buildings and people’s health in several countries. Also discusses the decline of air quality as a result of acid rain.
results.description: Notes the startling scale of acidified lakes in Europe and looks at the impact of acid rain on buildings and people’s health in several countries. Also discusses the decline of air quality as a result of acid rain.

results.title: Acid from heaven
results.creator_credit: George Mully and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Many years ago there was a popular song suggesting that each time it rained it rained pennies from heaven. Today’s reality is that when it rains, it rains acid from heaven. By re-enacting a case study of a person whose income was cut off as a direct result of acid rain, this presentation, composed of still photo montage, provides in laymen’s terms some basic information about this little-known form of pollution.

results.title: Acid
results.brief_description: Presents varying ideas about LSD as expressed by users, former users, scientists and experts. Considers the extensive research now in progress, the recent discoveries about the physiological and psychological effects, and possible therapeutic uses. Psychedelic slides by Don Snyder. Song “Acid” written by Art Ciocco, performed and arranged by Tony Luisi.

results.title: Achimota
results.creator_credit: John Page and British Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Shows the introduction of higher education to West Africa, Nigeria and the Gold Coast in the early part of the 20th century with the establishment of Achimota College, Gold Cast. Emphasises the need for preserving valuable elements of the African culture. Conversely however, ends up reinforcing the dominance of the western way of life over Africans under colonial rule. Commentary by Dr Julian Huxley.

results.title: Achieving sexual maturity
results.creator_credit: Ben Norman, FilmFair Communications and John Wiley and Sons
results.brief_description: The film deals with the sexual anatomy, physiology and behaviour of both sexes from conception to adulthood. It uses explicit live photography of nude males and females to explain external sexual anatomy - and graphics and diagrams for internal anatomy. It moves, in order through conception embryonic development, early childhood puberty, adolescence and adulthood. The film describes ovulation and menstruation in girls, ejaculation in boys and treats masturbation as a normal sexual activity in both sexes. At appropriate times through out the film, young people express spontaneous feelings and tell of individual experiences.
